resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

fsaintjacques commented on issue #4007: ARROW-4989: [C++] Find re2 on Ubuntu if asked to
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/4007#issuecomment-475673504
 
 
   I'm not sure if this is working as intended:
   
   ```
   + cmake -GNinja -DCMAKE_BUILD_TYPE=DEBUG -DARROW_BUILD_TESTS=ON -DARROW_BUILD_BENCHMARKS=ON -DBUILD_WARNING_LEVEL=CHECKIN -DARROW_USE_ASAN=OFF -DARROW_PYTHON=ON -DARROW_PARQUET=ON -DARROW_GANDIVA=ON -DARROW_PLASMA=ON -DARROW_FLIGHT=OFF -DCMAKE_INSTALL_PREFIX=/home/fsaintjacques/miniconda/envs/pyarrow-dev -DCMAKE_INST
   ALL_LIBDIR=lib -DRE2_SOURCE=SYSTEM /home/fsaintjacques/src/db/arrow/cpp 
   
   ...
   
   -- Checking for module 're2'
   --   Found re2, version 0.0.0
   -- Found RE2: /home/fsaintjacques/miniconda/envs/pyarrow-dev/lib/libre2.so
   ```
   
 
----------------------------------------------------------------

To respond to the message, please log on to GitHub and use the
URL above to go to the specific comment.

users@infra.apache.org

pitrou commented on issue #4007: ARROW-4989: [C++] Find re2 on Ubuntu if asked to
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/4007#issuecomment-475674497
 
 
   I don't know. One problem is that when "CONDA" is given, our CMake build translates it internally to "SYSTEM", and so on the level of individual dependencies, the two are undistinguishable.

fsaintjacques commented on issue #4007: ARROW-4989: [C++] Find re2 on Ubuntu if asked to
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/4007#issuecomment-475679290
 
 
   No, with conda's re2, it always pick it up. But if I have an activated conda shell, but with re2 installed with dpkg (and not within conda), it fails. Passing `-DRE2_SOURCE=SYSTEM` fixes this.

issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

fields.description: It seems it's not possible currently to build from a Conda environment but get re2 from the system Ubuntu package (it previously was).
fields.summary: [C++] Builds fails to find Ubuntu-packaged re2 library
